title: Compiler error inside of macro doesn't show where macro is invoked
body:
I'm working on a project and recently got this series of error messages:

```
   Compiling ares v0.1.0 (file:///Users/tyoverby/workspace/rust/ares-2/ares)
<std macros>:3:1: 3:42 error: mismatched types [E0308]
<std macros>:3 $ crate :: result :: Result :: Ok ( val ) => val , $ crate :: result :: Result
               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
<std macros>:3:1: 3:42 note: in this expansion of try! (defined in <std macros>)
<std macros>:3:1: 3:42 note: in this expansion of try! (defined in <std macros>)
<std macros>:3:1: 3:42 help: run `rustc --explain E0308` to see a detailed explanation
<std macros>:3:1: 3:42 note: expected type `&compiler::binding::Bound<'_, '_>`
<std macros>:3:1: 3:42 note:    found type `std::result::Result<_, _>`
<std macros>:3:52: 4:15 error: mismatched types [E0308]
<std macros>:3 $ crate :: result :: Result :: Ok ( val ) => val , $ crate :: result :: Result
                                                                  ^
<std macros>:3:52: 4:15 note: in this expansion of try! (defined in <std macros>)
<std macros>:3:52: 4:15 note: in this expansion of try! (defined in <std macros>)
<std macros>:3:52: 4:15 help: run `rustc --explain E0308` to see a detailed explanation
<std macros>:3:52: 4:15 note: expected type `&compiler::binding::Bound<'_, '_>`
<std macros>:3:52: 4:15 note:    found type `std::result::Result<_, _>`
error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
error: Could not compile `ares`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

As you can see, there is no indication as to where this error is coming from in _my_ code.  I get that I'm fudging a `try!` invocation somewhere, but that only narrows down the possibilities to several hundred lines in my codebase...

```
rustc -V
rustc 1.10.0-nightly (e0fd34bba 2016-05-09)
```
